CRITICAL.description: Must fix immediately. Security vulnerability, data loss risk, or production-breaking issue.

HIGH.description: Should fix soon. Significant code quality issue, potential bug, or reliability concern.
examples: Missing null check on critical path

MEDIUM.description: Should fix in next iteration. Code smell, maintainability concern, or minor performance issue.

LOW.description: Nice to fix. Minor code quality improvement with no functional impact.

INFO.description: Informational. Suggestion for improvement, not a real issue.

multi_model_rules.confirmed_by_2_models: Upgrade severity by one level (LOW -> MEDIUM, MEDIUM -> HIGH)
multi_model_rules.confirmed_by_3_models: Upgrade severity by one level AND mark as priority fix
multi_model_rules.single_model_only: Keep original severity, review manually for false positives
